runs.comm: length, pushed to point ... and Awais Zia is almost run-out, backing up way down the pitch! A direct hit would have done it but Broad missed. Hafeez yells in bewilderment at his partner
and gone! Fantastic catch at first slip from Pietersen! The delivery pitched on a length outside off, Hafeez swung well away from his body and edged a quick one through to the cordon
length, on the stumps, defended
length, pushed into the off side
pitched up, little bit of away swing, punched to mid-off and Bopara misses with a shy at the non-striker's end
defended on his stumps. "Is that his first defensive shot in international cricket?" wonders Gnasher to my right. You know, I think it is
hit on the pad, in front of leg - big appeal but turned down. Might have been sliding down down the leg side
goes off side, looses control, swings even further wide

Dernbach takes a sharp catch off his own bowling to remove Shafiq! The batsman drove hard through the ball but straight back at the bowler, who clung on. Another slick bit of fielding and England are rampant (well, almost)!
overpitched and driven fiercely past extra-cover
outside line, played into the off side
drifts on to the legs and clipped through midwicket
slower ball, out the back of the hand ... and well outside the return crease
and another one! Put the magic tricks back in the box, Paul Daniels ...
straight this time and Zia misses with a pull, the ball thunking into his body
full, driven back to the bowler, well fielded
advances down the wicket and whips the ball through the on side, lovely technique
length, outside off and dabbed to third man
straight, not quite short enough to pull but Zia tries anyway, the ball dribbling square
back of a length, defended to point on the back foot
or maybe not! Finn pitched it up, on leg stump and Zia clubs the ball high over long-on. When he connects, this lad, the ball goes places
length ball, pushed back down the wicket

dropped? Yes, and it should have been taken by Buttler. Umar flicked the ball from outside off through short midwicket and Buttler shelled it diving forwards. He's hurt his finger too and has to leave the field
skips out and batters the ball baseball-style over midwicket. Dernbach is steaming like a teapot
slower ball, back of the hand, guided to third man
again Dernbach rolls it out of his wrist and Zia mistimes an attempted hoick over cover, failing to connect
slung down the leg side and Zia watches it impassively
length, punched off the back foot to point
gives himself room and belabours a length ball well over long-on. Fantastic shot

slaps hard through the off side ... what a catch! Umar used his feet again, teeing off with a wristy cut but he picked out Morgan, who's terrific at point, and he snaffled it up for breakfast. The swashbuckling Umar perishes in unfortunate fashion
full, defended with a straight bat
on the stumps, pushed into the off side
back of a length, room to slash the ball down to third man
takes the pace off it, angled across the lefty, who misses again. He's not connected with all that many so far, has Zia. Though the one he has hit knew about it
length ball, on leg stump, punched square
Broad rolls his fingers over the ball, beating another misdirected swing from Zia. Still just one scoring shot for the opener, after more than five overs
angled across ... and another swing and a miss!
length, seaming away and, guess what, Zia tries to spank it down the ground again. You don't need me to tell you if he connected

holes out to mid-off - that, thankfully, puts Zia out of his misery. That was a shocking innings, really gruelling to watch as Zia tried to force slog after slog. He finally got bat on ball but only succeeded in dolly-ing it to the fielder
on leg, worked square
tossed up, defended
flighted, on off, turned to leg
full length, swept hard to backward square leg
driven down the ground
tight line outside off, pushed down the ground
length, not much turn, punched on the front foot to extra-cover
width, cut hard behind point
well run for three after working the ball fine, despite an optimistic appeal when Kieswetter broke the bails on the ball's return
off-stump line, played off the back foot on the wicket
full, takes the pace off it - Misbah defends
drops short and swivel-pulled hard between long-on and deep midwicket. As ever Misbah sets his own tempo
flighted, outside off, dabbed to short third man
tossed up on off, Misbah leans out and drives to long-on
short and wide, Malik steps away to cut in front of the sweeper in the deep

another one gone! Pakistan's innings is in tatters here. Swann, as ever, gave the ball some air, Malik tried to lift the ball over midwicket but got under it and picked out Bairstow running in from the boundary
on the stumps, prodded to midwicket
length, punched off the back foot down to long-on
length, on the stumps, jabbed to short midwicket
length, off-stump line with a touch of reverse, defended late on his stumps
on the stumps, angling down leg, Misbah drops his bat on it
length ball, outside off, Misbah <del>reverse paddles the ball for six!</del> defends
dropped to short third man for one
maintains that tight line and length, nudged into the leg side
goes down for a powerful, connects well out to deep square
on the stumps, worked into the leg side
tries to invent something, goes for a reverse sweep and doesn't come close to making contact. Taken on the back leg but well outside off
lovely stuff, tossed up by Swann and it's pushed back to him
still can't get it away, touch quicker on off stump and it's blocked
goes for another reverse sweep, big appeal for lbw from Swann but the umpire not interested and it's a leg bye to short third man
on the back foot, cut firmly out to deep cover
That. Is. Huge. A little bit of air from Patel, Afridi strides down the pitch and drives it straight into the top tier over long-on. He needs a few of them, too
quicker and flatter from Patel, Afridi on the back foot and pulls through midwicket
steps away to leg and gives himself room to drive this down to long-off
picks the gap on the leg side with a fairly ugly, but very effective, heave and the crowd are getting excited
and another to end the over, leans back and drives over the top of cover with power to beat the sweeper. In one over the game is alive again
what a catch! Bairstow at deep midwicket plucks out a low grab as Misbah tried to match Afridi and go over deep midwicket. He ran in from the boundary and grasped it inches off the turf
a technical drop by Swann as Afridi drills a catch back to him and it burst through his hands
on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
outside off, nicely driven through the covers. Might have been two, but Afridi wants the strike
fired in at leg stump, he wasn't going to give that much air, and it's tucked to square leg
lapped away to short fine leg, England won't mind him taking that single
hint of inswing, Azam opens the face and guides to backward point
appeal for lbw as Azam moves across the crease but he was struck outside off stump...another useful dot ball, however
that's handsome. A full delivery outside off stump and Azam unleashes a sweetly-struck lofted cover drive
well, well. Picks up another full-length delivery and strikes it well clear of long-off. Pressure back on Bopara
calmly played, runs this fine of backward point from off stump
good delivery to end with, nips back and cramps Afridi for room. Takes an inside edge into the pads and into the off side
he's ticking now. Game on. Hangs on the back foot and picks up a decent-length delivery with a flat pull over midwicket
good comeback from Broad, beats the outside edge with some swing as Azam tries to run it through the off side
beaten again, zips away off the seam and Azam is caught flat-footed playing away from his body
brilliant stuff from Azam, he frees his arms over the off side against a full, slightly floating delivery, and places it wide of deep cover
walks right across his crease but can only get a leading edge back towards the bowler. Think Broad had a word.
beats the edge for the third time but Azam has given Pakistan a chance
misses a big heave to the on side and is taken on the back leg
slower delivery, dragged down a little and flat-batted down to long-on

gone! And another stunning catch. Azam sent this miles into the night sky and Buttler has ages to think about things at long-off. These are tough to take, and he almost misjudges it then takes it tumbling backwards.
another dot ball, tries to launch over the leg side and doesn't connect
swinging into the pads, beats Afridi's leg-side swipe and it loops back to Bopara
oh dear, Ravi, he's overstepped. That's very poor. On leg stump and flicked to deep square
swing and miss, no damage done for England
full on leg stump, swung away towards short fine leg where Samit Patel dives well to make a one-handed stop with his left hand
dropped in short, and very well played as he helps it over short fine leg with a controlled swivel-hook...was a very controlled shot, he'd read the field. Not a great delivery
that's big. This isn't over. Finn offers up length again and Gul launches it comfortably over deep midwicket

that's finished that. Finn gambles with another short one, Gul tries to repeat the earlier shot of short fine leg but gets a top edge that flies straight up. Kieswetter trotted around and took it easily.
backs away to leg, swings across the line, gets a bottom edge into his pads which rolls back to Finn

sharp work from Finn. Started with a good yorker which Afridi struggled to dig out, the ball rolled towards Finn in his follow through and he swooped to thrown down the stumps to leave Ajmal well short. Hmm, did Finn have a little push at Ajmal there after completing the run out?
outside off and left alone (!) which suggests Afridi badly misjudged the line
excellent yorker, inswinging at Afridi's toes and he refuses a single to long-on
full delivery is driven strongly down the ground, one bounce to long-off...no damage
full outside off, Cheema tries to play into the off side but can only push it back to Dernbach
slower ball, comes out as a low full toss but Cheema can't get it past Morgan at backward point
another low full toss, pushed through the covers but they turn down the run
slower ball, back of the hand, wide of off stump and Afridi doesn't offer a shot

gone! Job done by England. Afridi tries to launch a good-length delivery over the leg side and it skews high into the off side where Morgan, running from backward point, holds a good catch. Boy, England have fielded well tonight.
